title: Tempeh and Garlic Bake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 180°C.
Toss garlic and onion with half the peanut butter, salt, pepper and lemon & herb; spread on a tray.
Season tempeh and place on the tray. Roast for 32 min, turning once.
Cook the brown rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Brown rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: German Greek yogurt (0%) wrap
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat tahini in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook greek yogurt (0%) 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry green beans and courgette with italian herbs 34 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Tortilla wrap or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Salmon for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Jasmine rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Vietnamese Lentils with Couscous & Kale
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat ghee in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook lentils 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry kale and garlic with smoked paprika + cumin 29 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Scottish Prawns traybake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 200°C.
Toss peppers and carrots with half the ghee, salt, pepper and thai green curry paste; spread on a tray.
Season prawns and place on the tray. Air-fry for 33 min, turning once.
Cook baby potatoes until tender (18–25 min roasted).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Prawns for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Scottish Chickpeas with Jasmine rice & Peas
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat tahini in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook chickpeas 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry peas and courgette with smoked paprika + cumin 27 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the jasmine rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Jasmine rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Brazilian Tuna (canned) traybake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C.
Toss courgette and cherry tomatoes with half the rapeseed oil, salt, pepper and harissa; spread on a tray.
Season tuna (canned) and place on the tray. Roast for 36 min, turning once.
Cook the quinoa according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Tuna for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Quinoa or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: British Black beans traybake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat almonds in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook black beans 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry mushrooms and garlic with cajun blend 20 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the jasmine rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Jasmine rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: British Salmon fillet with Tortilla wrap & Peas
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook salmon fillet 3–4 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry peas and cherry tomatoes with italian herbs 27 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Salmon for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Tortilla wrap or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
